concept.title: Concept Basics
concept.shortdesc: A topic that describes an idea.

conbody.p: Concepts are the most generic of the specialized topics.
A concept topic must contain the following:
conbody.codeblock:
Topic title The short description of the topic

Your topic content goes here. Most all basic authoring elements are allowed here.

dlentry.dd: The root element for the concept topic.

All topics must have a title. Unless you provide titlealts (alternative titles for search results or navigation), the content of this element shows up wherever you link to this topic. The title appears in the topic as the heading, in the table of contents, and as the generated text in links to this topic.
While not required, the short description really, really should be. See .
Container for the content, or body, of the topic.

conbody.p: The conbody contains the meat of your topic. You can use most all of the basic building blocks in a concept. See .
